snippet: The president accused the American Israel Public Affairs Committee of spending millions on advertising to try to defeat the accord, as well as spreading misinformation about it.
abstract: Pres Obama denounces opponents of Iran nuclear accord during speech at American University, seemingly taking jabs at pro-Israel group American Israel Public Affairs Committee; remarks reflect unusually sharp rupture between sitting American president and most potent pro-Israel lobbying group, raising worries of lasting rift.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The president accused the American Israel Public Affairs Committee of spending millions on advertising to try to defeat the accord, as well as spreading misinformation about it.

headline.main: Fears of Lasting Rift as Obama Battles Pro-Israel Group on Iran
headline.print_headline: Obama Battles Pro-Israel Group, Raising Worries of a Lasting Rift

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
